page.title: 17LOCAL HISTORY-NAMES LIVE ON
page.content: Anthony Roper died in 1599 but left property and money for the benifit of the people of our community for all time. His name was chosen for our school as a link between the two communities which the school mainly serves,Farningham and Eynsford. The school badge has a stags head part of the coat of arms of the Roper family. We have this on our school T-shirt . Every junior leaving for secondary school is presented with a bible by the trustees of Ropers Charity. We are reminded of him every day. Wadard was a Norman knight in the centre of a scene from the Bayeux Tapestry who was Sub-tenant of the manor of Farningham. The villagers still remember him. Many have T-shirts with his motif-it also appears as a weather vane motif on the villagehall.
